#Text=CanadaVOTES : CHP candidate Henry Zekveld running in Durham
#Text=Friday , September 26 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=Christian Heritage Party candidate Henry Zekveld is standing for election in the riding of Durham .
#Text=Born in Lindsay and raised on a dairy farm , Henry studied at Woodstock 's Fanshawe Agriculture College in 1987 , the same year he joined the Christian Heritage Party .
#Text=A farmer for the last 11 years , he is an active member of a local church , serving as deacon and , currently , an elder .
#Text=He is a member of the Canadian Federation of Independent Business , and serves on the local board of the Christian Farmers ' Federation of Ontario .
#Text=He ran for office as a CHP candidate Huron-Bruce ( 1993 ) and Durham ( 2006 ) .
#Text=Wikinews contacted John , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .

#Text=A riding from 1904 to 1968 , and since 1988 , Durham includes Newcastle , Scugog , Uxbridge , Scugog Indian Reserve No. 34 , Whitby north of Taunton Road , and Oshawa north of Rossland Road and some other allowances .
#Text=Conservative Bev Oda currently holds the riding ; she is the Minister of Canadian Heritage and Status of Women , as well as Minister for International Cooperation .
#Text=Looking to take this riding from Oda are Zekveld , Stephen Leahy ( Green ) , Andrew McKeever ( NDP ) , and Bryan Ransom ( Liberal ) .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=Canada 's Judeo Christian foundations have made Canada to be a land of freedom and prosperity .
#Text=These foundations must be retained for the continued good of Canada .

#Text=Because the Christian Heritage Party of Canada is the only federal party which bases their policy and platform on Biblical principle , because these values are important to me and because I love God and my country , I am running as candidate for the CHP in the EDA where I live , Durham .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=The Christian Heritage Party has been my party of choice from 1987 on .
#Text=I have been actively involved in it since then .
#Text=I am accountable to God in all that I do and I take seriously my stewardship over the earth as a farmer , for my wife and family , serving my local church , and serving my country , Canada .
#Text=The greatest virtue as a politician serving my constituents would be selflessness .
#Text=My experience in the list above has taught me the importance and joy of giving for the benefit of others – I would like to use this to the benefit of my fellow Canadians .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=The Durham electoral district has a high percentage of farmers and is a bedroom community for manufacturing .
#Text=Manufacturing is a top concern for our electorate as General Motors and its suppliers are a major employer .
#Text=I believe the emphasis should shift from funnelling funds to General Motors in its present state and looking futuristic .
#Text=Car manufacturing should be focusing on renewable energy sources such as cars powered by water , air , or electricity .
#Text=Funds should reward invention and inventors .
#Text=Canada could be on the leading edge of technology and manufacture would again thrive .
#Text=All Canadians are concerned with food safety .
#Text=In Canada we have high standards for our agricultural products .
#Text=Our safety standards include employee safety , pesticide and herbicide standards , and quality standards .
#Text=Canada has high standards to protect the health of its citizens .
#Text=Imports with lower standards should not be allowed into Canada .
#Text=Not only does it compromise the health and welfare of Canadian citizens , but also it undermines our farmers as many imported food products are produced here already .
#Text=These imports also need inspection using our tax dollars to do so .
#Text=Canadians expect safe food .
#Text=Due diligence must be given .
#Text=Accessibility to healthcare .
#Text=First the Christian Heritage Party sees healthcare as a provincial matter .
#Text=The federal government should not be controlling any province ’s jurisdiction in healthcare .
#Text=Money should be transferred without “ strings attached . ”
#Text=The Christian Heritage Party ’s policy involves adding private services to help alleviate backlog .
#Text=Not only would Canadians receive quicker service , but also better service .
#Text=Competition would create better service , shorter waiting time , and cost efficient delivery of services .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=The Christian Heritage Party of Canada is often seen as being religious .
#Text=We are no moLre religious than the Conservatives or Liberals .
#Text=Every person is religious whether we acknowledge it or not .
#Text=It may be Christian , Hindu , Muslim , or Secular Humanist .
#Text=Everyone has a belief system and this belief system influences thoughts , words , and actions – no one excluded .
#Text=The Christian Heritage Party has the vision Canada ’s Founding Fathers had as written in the preamble of our constitution , “ The supremacy of God and the rule of law . ”
#Text=The rule of law is based on God ’s law in the Ten Commandments and elsewhere in the Bible .
#Text=These standards are time tested and have given direction to Canada since its inception .
#Text=There 's a more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=We ’re starting to realize the importance of technology .
#Text=The “ tried-and-true routes ” are still effective but the internet is a tremendous asset .
